intro: Stryphnodendron holosericeum, commonly known as the white angel's trumpet, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its large, showy, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, pale green bark and is often found growing in moist, shaded areas of the rainforest canopy. Its leaves are ovate and emit a mild fragrance, while its fruit is a follicle containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated outside its natural range.
